intro: Mapouria sclerocalyx, commonly known as the hard-shelled mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate, with a rough texture and prominent veins. Mapouria sclerocalyx is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display and adaptability to various soil conditions.
